revised_title: Spectrum-Analysis of Crystalloid Substances in the Body
tldr: The author, Henry Bence Jones, conducted experiments to study the rapidity of crystalloid substances, specifically lithium and rubidium, entering the vascular and non-vascular textures of the body. Using spectrum-analysis, he observed the penetration of these substances in various tissues, including the lens, cartilage, and aqueous humor of guinea pigs. The findings suggest that lithium can penetrate deeper into the tissues than rubidium.
